Content:: Pleun Strik (27 May 1944 – 14 July 2022) was a Dutch professional footballer who played as a defender.[1] Strik played two matches for the Netherlands national team in the 1970 FIFA World Cup qualification tournament,[1] and he made the Dutch squad for the 1974 FIFA World Cup,[2] although he did not play in the tournament.[1] Strik played club football with PSV Eindhoven for over eight years in the late 1960s and 1970s, and made a total of 28 appearances for them in UEFA club competitions. This included four games in the 1975–76 European Cup, although he did not play in the semi-final matches against Saint-Ã‰tienne.[3]  This biographical article related to association football in the Netherlands, about a defender, is a stub.
